intro: Phyllanthus sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and forested areas at high altitudes. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
